author: Valentina Raffio
title: La DANA coge fuerza en Andalucía y obliga a activar una alerta roja en Huelva
text: Datos de AEMET La DANA coge fuerza en Andalucía y obliga a activar una alerta roja en Huelva Para este viernes se mantienen activas varias alertas naranjas en el sur de Cataluña, varios puntos de la Comunidad Valenciana así como en Mallorca y Menorca Valentina Raffio La [DANA](/tags/dana/) ha vuelto a activarse este viernes desde primera hora y ha empezado a descargar con fuerza en Andalucía. La Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET) ha activado una alerta roja para el litoral de Huelva, donde se podrían dar acumulaciones de más de 140 litros por metro cuadrado en tan solo unas horas. En localidades como Cartaya ya se han acumulado más de 117 litros por metro cuadrado en menos de tres horas, de los cuales 70 en un hora. Las autoridades piden a los ciudadanos de la zona extremar precauciones. Para este viernes también hay activadas varias alertas amarillas en el sur de Cataluña, el norte de la Comunitat Valenciana y en Mallorca y Menorca ante el riesgo de que la DANA vuelva a causar lluvias torrenciales en estas zonas. En Cataluña, la alerta naranja se concentra en las comarcas del Montsià y Baix Ebre, que acumulan dos días consecutivos de lluvias extremas, ante la previsión de que caigan más de 100 litros por metro cuadrado durante esta jornada. Los modelos aún se muestran inciertos sobre cómo evolucionará esta DANA en los próximos días. Este episodio empezó ya el fin de semana pasado, se ha extendido durante todo esta semana y seguramente continuará de cara al puente de Todos los Santos y el fin de semana. A partir de ahí, aún no está muy claro cuándo acabarán definitivamente estas lluvias. Por ahora, todo apunta a que a principios de la semana que viene se debilitarán mucho y probablemente se vayan apaciguando con el tiempo. Aun así, dada la evolución errática de este fenómeno, aún es pronto para ponerle fecha final a este episodio que ha causado tantas lluvias torrenciales. author: Jonathan Park
title: Full Wireless Service outage at UPC, remote offices planned for Thursday
text:
Full Wireless Service outage at UPC, remote offices planned for Thursday 
The outage will begin at 10 p.m. and last approximately four hours as Information Technology Services conducts network maintenance.






 By NATHAN ELIAS 


 November 14, 2024


 
 

 


All Wireless Services at University Park Campus and remote offices will be unavailable for approximately four hours today beginning at 10 p.m. while Information Technology Services conducts network maintenance, according to an ITS News Slack message. The outage will not affect the Health Sciences Campus.

 
 Daily headlines, sent straight to your inbox. 
 Subscribe to our newsletter to keep up with the latest at and around USC. 
 
 
 
 
 
 





 DONATION PLUG – PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH 


 Thank you for reading the\xa0 Daily Trojan . 
We are the only independent newspaper here at USC, run at every level by students. That means we aren’t tied down by any other interests but those of readers like you: the students, faculty, staff and South Central residents that together make up the USC community.

Independence is a double-edged sword: We have a unique lens into the University’s actions and policies, and can hold powerful figures accountable when others cannot. But that also means\xa0 our budget is severely limited . We’re already spread thin as we compensate the writers, photographers, artists, designers and editors whose incredible work you see in our daily paper; as we work to revamp and expand our digital presence, we now have additional staff making podcasts, videos, webpages, our first ever\xa0 magazine and social media content, who are at risk of being unable to receive the support they deserve.

We are therefore indebted to readers like you, who, by supporting us, help keep our paper daily (we are the only remaining college paper on the West Coast that prints every single weekday), independent, free and widely accessible.

 Please consider supporting us. Even $1 goes a long way in supporting our work; if you are able, you can also support us with monthly, or even annual, donations. Thank you.

author: Redação Oeste
title: Preta Gil faz nova cirurgia para retirada de tumores
text:
A cantora Preta Gil entrou em processo cirúrgico nesta quinta-feira, 19, para retirada de tumores. O procedimento, no Hospital Sírio-Libanês, em São Paulo, deve terminar somente na madrugada desta sexta-feira, 20. As informações são da equipe médica da artista.
Até a última atualização deste texto, não havia novidades sobre a situação da cantora. Uma amiga de Preta, no entanto, postou em uma rede social a informação de que tudo estava dentro do programado.
Preta Gil tem várias complicações
Em 2023, Preta tratou de um tumor no intestino e foi considerada curada. No entanto, em agosto deste ano, depois de realizar exames de monitoramento, a cantora anunciou o retorno da doença em diferentes partes do corpo.
Conforme os exames, a filha de Gilberto Gil tem dois tumores nos linfonodos, que são estruturas que atuam na remoção de impurezas e na defesa do organismo. Ela tem ainda um nódulo no ureter – tubos que transportam a urina dos rins para a bexiga.
“Surpresa nada agradável”, diz cantora
Outra anomalia é uma metástase no peritônio, em que o câncer se espalha pela membrana que protege os órgãos abdominais. “Fui para o hospital fazer o check-up tranquila. De repente, vem uma surpresa nada agradável como essa, num exame de rotina”, disse a cantora em recente entrevista ao Fantástico.
Na ocasião, ela contou que já estava fazendo tratamento para combater as células cancerígenas, chamado quimioterapia. Na última semana, no entanto, por recomendação de sua equipe médica, Preta foi para os Estados Unidos.
O objetivo era consultar uma especialista nos tipos de tumor presentes no seu diagnóstico. Desse modo, Preta teria mais alternativas para o tratamento pós-cirúrgico. A cantora pediu “boas vibrações” e disse que achava importante compartilhar como está. “Se Deus quiser, farei o tratamento que for mais indicado para mim, no Brasil ou fora”.
+ Leia mais notícias de Brasil na Oeste

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Fierce lake-effect snowstorm buries western New York creating dangerous whiteouts
text:
By Gina Martinez ,
1 hours ago Parts of New York that have been inundated with snow will finally see an end to heavy snowfall at the end of this week.
A fierce lake-effect snowstorm is nearing its end across the Great Lakes. While heavy snow continue to pummel areas east of lakes Erie and Ontario , relief is on the horizon as the storm is expected to weaken by Friday evening, Fox Weather reported. Eden, New York, has been received over 3.5 feet of snow since Thursday, while other surrounding areas have gotten over 2.5 feet.
T he strong winds and heavy snowfall have led to dangerous travel conditions and prompted a state of emergency in parts of New York state. Off Lake Ontario, the band of heavy snow will cross into the Tug Hill region and end up in northern, or even central Oswego County by Friday morning, Fox Weather reported.
Christmas snow alert as Polar Vortex poised to dump 11 feet in days before big holiday
World's longest underwater 'mega tunnel' to cost $46 billion but will halve 21-hour drive
The band should then remain over northern Oswego County all throughout Friday, gradually shrinking back to the lakeshore before ending Saturday, the FOX Forecast Center said. The FOX Forecast Center said some light snow may linger across Chautauqua County on Friday, but this will be light and should end completely later in the day.
Orchard Park, New York, located downwind of Lake Erie, has received 30 inches of snow since Thursday. The city has also issued a local state of emergency and implemented a driving ban. "Town Highway and Village (Department of Public Works) crews have been working throughout the night (Thursday) to remove snow from roadways," police said in a Facebook post .
"Our 911 center and police personnel are handling an increasing number of calls for service. Please adhere to the driving ban as we all work collectively to keep our community safe."
Erie County Executive Mark Poloncarz said he was advised that local states of emergency have also been declared in towns across western New York, including Brant and Evans. Poloncarz said an Erie County Department of Public Works plow truck drove off the road on Route 20 in the Evans and Hamburg areas. That driver was not injured.
Exclusive FOX Weather Storm Tracker Corey Gerken was in Hamburg on Thursday morning and said it was the heaviest snowfall he’d seen in the area in quite a while. "Everyone is getting stuck on the roads," he said. "It’s a complete nightmare out here."
Video captured at Frederick Douglass Greater Rochester International Airport on Thursday showed planes waiting to be de-iced during heavy snowfall.
5
